children.subject:
Is your second major application actually processed, i.e. accepted by the university, or did you just get the signature?

I don't think that you can actually be accepted as a CS major until after you submit the double major application form, which means you'll be registering for classes as a non-CS student until you get that processed (which, if I recall correctly, takes a few weeks after you submit the form?)

history.content: Yes, assuming you're already declared in another major, the system will not recognize you as a simult. degree until you file the paperwork. This requires obtaining all signatures, and meeting with an L&S Adviser at 206 Evans Hall. I believe the paperwork then gets sent to Sproul Hall and takes a couple of weeks to process. Only at that time with you be declared in the major and coded as a CS student.

I major in Environmental Science, and I was just accepted as a LSCS major student. But I haven't obtain the signature from CS Advisor on the Simultaneous Major Application Form yet. Will this will affect my CS course enrollment for Phase II? I am going obtain the signatures when semester starts. Will it be too late?
history.subject: Question about course enrollment for simultaneous major
